qas.question: When did the Venezuelans emigrate to the united states?

answers.text: Until the 20th century, there was no clear record of the number of Venezuelans who emigrated to the United States.

qas.question: Does Venezuela have immigrates from other countries?

answers.text: Between the 18th and early 19th centuries, there were many European immigrants who went to Venezuela

qas.question: Why did Venezuelans come to America?

answers.text: Many Venezuelans settled in the United States with hopes of receiving a better education, only to remain in there following graduation.

qas.question: Do Venezuelans still come to America for the same reasons as they did before?

answers.text: since the early 1980s, the reasons for Venezuelan emigration have changed to include hopes of earning a higher salary

qas.question: When did the Venezuelans emmigrate to Mexico?

plausible_answers.text: with hopes of receiving a better education

qas.question: Why did Europeans come to America?
Since when has European immigration included hopes of a higher salary?
How many South Americans emigrated to Mexico from 1910 to 1930?
When did Europenan immigrants go to Venezuela and later to Mexico?

context: <a0_0>Until <b4_0>the 20th century<b4_0/>, there was no clear record of the number of Venezuelans who emigrated to the United States.<a0_0/> <a1_0><b8_0>Between the 18th and early 19th centuries<b8_0/>, there were many European immigrants who went to Venezuela<a1_0/>, only to later migrate to the United States along with their children and grandchildren who born and/or grew up in Venezuela speaking Spanish. From 1910 to 1930, it is estimated that <b7_0>over 4,000<b7_0/> South Americans each year emigrated to the United States; however, there are few specific figures indicating these statistics. <a2_0>Many Venezuelans settled in the United States <b5_0>with hopes of receiving a better education<b5_0/>, only to remain in there following graduation.<a2_0/> They are frequently joined by relatives. However, <a3_0>since the <b6_0>early 1980s<b6_0/>, the reasons for Venezuelan emigration have changed to include hopes of earning a higher salary<a3_0/> and due to the economic fluctuations in Venezuela which also promoted an important migration of Venezuelan professionals to the US.
